content.description: Big juggy holds on the lower part suitable for slight lay-back start. Left hand moves up to a crimp. Right foot matches right hand on jug and right hand moves up to high crimp. Left hand moves up to large sloper top out.
content.location: This route in on the North East end of the MBA South area. Follow FS road 2683 to the large circular turn around (about 2-miles in from the main road). Park there and follow the foot trail West about 0.1 mi. This is near the east edge of the outcrop.

content.description: Follow a thin dirty lichen covered seam via a few well placed feet to the top. Just a little something for an afternoon finger burn if you're in the area.

Hug the cracks to get your feet up on the obvious shelf. Right hand moves up to a jam near the top, left hand grabs the broken chunks wedged in the first of the 3 finger-like cracks. Crux is then smearing up to foot pocket at mid-wall and toping out just left of the ferns.
content.location: North East end of MBA South area.

content.description: A nice big outcropping of granite just east of Highway 32 and north of Highway W near Mountain, WI. Most of the good stuff is on National Forest land (no access issues). There are at least four distinct regions, East outcrop, North outcrop, South outcrop (the largest), and west Outcrop. Full of short and medium boulder problemsÂ—everything from one move wonders to 30ft cranks. Some of the areas definitely require some solid spotters because the talus is pretty rugged and it can be hard to find a flat landing spot for a pad.
